Package model

Interface UserModelExtension

All Superinterfaces:
User
All Known Implementing Classes:
UserModelExtensionImpl
public interface UserModelExtension extends User
This interface extends the User Model interface and has methods to invest amounts in a portfolio according to dollar cost averaging strategy. This interface also allows strategies that have no end date.

  • Method Summary

    Description

    dollarCostAveragingPortfolio(String pname, Map<String,Double> m, double amount, double commissionFee, String startDate, String endDate, int interval)

  • Method Details

    • investFractionalPercentage

      boolean investFractionalPercentage(String pname, String date, double amount, Map<String,Double> m, double commissionFee) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to invest a certain amount entered by the user across a series of stocks based on their fractional weights.
      Parameters:
      pname - is the name of the portfolio where user wants to invest the amount.
      date - is the date at which user wants to invest the amount.
      amount - is the amount the user wants to invest.
      m - is the map of the fractional distribution of stocks which maps the ticker of stocks to the fractional percentage to be invested.
      commissionFee - is the commission fee charged per transaction.
      Returns:
      true if the investment is successful without any errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if portfolio name does not exist, if date is not properly formatted, if the date is in the future, if amount in negative, if commissionFee is negative, if the sum of fractional distribution of stocks does not sum up to be 100%.

    • dollarCostAveragingPortfolio

      boolean dollarCostAveragingPortfolio(String pname, Map<String,Double> m, double amount, double commissionFee, String startDate, String endDate, int interval) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method creates a portfolio (if not exists) or invests in a portfolio (if exists) according to the dollar cost averaging strategy. This method allows the user to not specify an end date which means that the investment is still ongoing.
      Parameters:
      pname - is the name of portfolio to be created/ invested in according to dollar cost averaging strategy.
      m - is the map of the fractional distribution of stocks which maps the ticker of stocks to the fractional percentage to be invested.
      amount - is the amount the user wants to invest.
      commissionFee - is the commission fee charged per transaction.
      startDate - is the date from which user wants to start investing in his portfolio.
      endDate - is the date at which he wants to end investing in his portfolio.
      interval - is the frequency in days at which he wants to make periodic investments in his portfolio.
      Returns:
      true if a portfolio is created successfully according to dollar cost averaging method.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if dates are not properly formatted, if interval is negative, if amount in negative, if commissionFee is negative, if the sum of fractional distribution of stocks does not sum up to be 100%.

    • loadPersistantStrategy

      boolean loadPersistantStrategy(String pname) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to load the persistent strategy which was persisted because the amount was to be invested in the future. So this method loads that strategy and compares the start date of that strategy with the current date and if the start date is less than the current date, it makes the investment for the user, updates the user portfolio and also updates the start date of the persisted strategy.
      Parameters:
      pname - is the name of the portfolio which is to be loaded.
      Returns:
      true if the strategy is loaded and all the operations are performed successfully on it without any error.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is some problem reading from and writing to the file.

    • showPerformance

      Map<String,Double> showPerformance(String pName, String sDate, String eDate) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to display performace of a particular portfolio over a period of time.
      Parameters:
      pName - is the name of the portfolio whose performance is to be viewed.
      sDate - is the start date at which user wants to start viewing the portfolio performance.
      eDate - is the end date at which user wants to stop viewing the portfolio performance.
      Returns:
      the map containing the date mapping to the portfolio valuation at that date.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if date format is improper or if start date is greater than the end date.
